{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Head, Capital Market Business",
  "description": "Central Securities Clearing System Plc [CSCS] is Nigeria&#39;s Central Securities Depository (CSD) licensed to carry on the depository, clearing and settlement of all transactions in the Nigerian Capital Market. As the country&rsquo;s premier Financial Market Infrastructure (FMI), CSCS processes securities in electronic book-entry form, ensuring safe and efficient transaction processing within the ecosystem whilst also pioneering innovative solutions to deepen and enhance the efficient functioning of the market.

We provide an effective single access point for all post-trade services in the Nigerian financial market, covering all forms of capital and money market securities including equities, treasury bills, bonds, commodities, funds and cash. With an &quot;A+&rdquo; CSD rating from Thomas Murray, CSCS ranks amongst the best-rated financial services firms in Nigeria and one of the best-rated FMI in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Capital Market Business

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Description


	The Head of Capital Market Business will manage growth and relationship of CSCS client networks to achieve optimal adoption and retention of CSCS Capital Market products and services, as well as identification of new businesses and opportunities to inform the development of products/services.
	They will also manage and improve income generation from our Collateral Management Business.


Key Responsibilities


	Support the execution of CSCS&rsquo; marketing strategy and plan.
	Support efforts to increase sales, revenue, subscriptions, through the development of new capital market products.
	Follow up with sales target of team members.
	Ensure compliance with policies that promote the company strategy, culture, mission and vision and ensures they are cascaded to all employees. Provides strong direction and leadership, ensuring clear strategic objectives are in place to guide the work of the unit.
	Coordinate effective and efficient administration and reconciliation of all customers accounts.
	Review all proposals with the management.
	Provide input to financial projections and cost benefits for new products/opportunities.
	Introduce CSCS Capital Market products and services to existing/potential customers and assists them in selecting those best suited to their needs.
	Contribute to the preparation and implementation of comprehensive annual marketing plans and strategies for the department to facilitate the achievement of CSCS&rsquo;s set goals.
	Promote the building of sustainable relationships between CSCS and clients.
	Contribute to the effective launching of new products to ensure favourable market response and optimum build-up of revenue.
	Coordinate and supervises the activities of the department to ensure optimal achievement of set targets, value creation and enhance profitability of CSCS.
	Manage client expectations appropriately and represents the CSCS&rsquo; interests always.
	Promote a strong team culture.
	Provide input to product costing and fee negotiation.


Requirements


	Minimum of a University Degree or HND in Marketing, Business Administration, Economics or any other relevant social science discipline from a reputable institution.
	Professional membership of relevant professional body in the Capital market.
	8 - 10 years of post-graduation experience in the capital market with at least five (5) years&rsquo; experience in a management role.
	Experience in digital marketing, performance marketing and lead generation and analytics.
	Good knowledge of the Capital Market and Information Technology.
	Experience in Social networking and use of social analytics tools.
",

  "validThrough": "2025-08-26",

Head, Capital Market Business Job at Central Securities Clearing System Plc




        
    

        
        Central Securities Clearing System Plc [CSCS] is Nigeria's Central Securities Depository (CSD) licensed to carry on the depository, clearing and settlement of all transactions in the Nigerian Capital Market. As the country’s premier Financial Market Infrastructure (FMI), CSCS processes securities in electronic book-entry form, ensuring safe and efficient transaction processing within the ecosystem whilst also pioneering innovative solutions to deepen and enhance the efficient functioning of the market.
     

            
    



We provide an effective single access point for all post-trade services in the Nigerian financial market, covering all forms of capital and money market securities including equities, treasury bills, bonds, commodities, funds and cash. With an "A+” CSD rating from Thomas Murray, CSCS ranks amongst the best-rated financial services firms in Nigeria and one of the best-rated FMI in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Capital Market Business

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Description


	The Head of Capital Market Business will manage growth and relationship of CSCS client networks to achieve optimal adoption and retention of CSCS Capital Market products and services, as well as identification of new businesses and opportunities to inform the development of products/services.
	They will also manage and improve income generation from our Collateral Management Business.


Key Responsibilities


	Support the execution of CSCS’ marketing strategy and plan.
	Support efforts to increase sales, revenue, subscriptions, through the development of new capital market products.
	Follow up with sales target of team members.
	Ensure compliance with policies that promote the company strategy, culture, mission and vision and ensures they are cascaded to all employees. Provides strong direction and leadership, ensuring clear strategic objectives are in place to guide the work of the unit.
	Coordinate effective and efficient administration and reconciliation of all customers accounts.
	Review all proposals with the management.
	Provide input to financial projections and cost benefits for new products/opportunities.
	Introduce CSCS Capital Market products and services to existing/potential customers and assists them in selecting those best suited to their needs.
	Contribute to the preparation and implementation of comprehensive annual marketing plans and strategies for the department to facilitate the achievement of CSCS’s set goals.
	Promote the building of sustainable relationships between CSCS and clients.
	Contribute to the effective launching of new products to ensure favourable market response and optimum build-up of revenue.
	Coordinate and supervises the activities of the department to ensure optimal achievement of set targets, value creation and enhance profitability of CSCS.
	Manage client expectations appropriately and represents the CSCS’ interests always.
	Promote a strong team culture.
	Provide input to product costing and fee negotiation.


Requirements


	Minimum of a University Degree or HND in Marketing, Business Administration, Economics or any other relevant social science discipline from a reputable institution.
	Professional membership of relevant professional body in the Capital market.
	8 - 10 years of post-graduation experience in the capital market with at least five (5) years’ experience in a management role.
	Experience in digital marketing, performance marketing and lead generation and analytics.
	Good knowledge of the Capital Market and Information Technology.
	Experience in Social networking and use of social analytics tools.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "title": "Marketing Executive",
  "description": "Apex Forte Professionals is a company specializing in providing recruitment and staffing solutions. Their primary objective is to connect highly skilled professionals with organizations that need their expertise, ensuring a good match between the candidates&#39; skills and the clients&#39; requirements. This involves a range of services, including talent acquisition, workforce management, and consulting to help businesses build effective teams and achieve their goals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria
Employment Type: Contract

Job Description
Sales Management Task:


	Sales Performance Oversight: Maintain up-to-date records to track and ensure targets are met by both the sales team collectively and individual vendors.


Requirements
Be a part of the TEAM across Nigeria:


	Experience: At least 6 months previous experience in sales or a related field.
	Leadership: Ability to lead a sales campaign in their respective states
	Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills.
	Strategic Thinking: Capacity to develop and implement sales strategies effectively.
	Results-Oriented: Focus on achieving and exceeding sales targets.
	Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze sales data and Market trends.
	Customer Focus: Commitment to customer satisfaction and retention.
	Organizational Skills: Managing time and prioritizing tasks efficiently.
	Adaptability: Flexibility to adjust strategies in response to market dynamics.
	Team Player: Collaborative approach to working with cross-functional teams.


Salary
N70,000 - N80,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to:&nbsp;apexforteprofs@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Marketing Executive Job at Apex Forte Professionals




        
    

        
        Apex Forte Professionals is a company specializing in providing recruitment and staffing solutions. Their primary objective is to connect highly skilled professionals with organizations that need their expertise, ensuring a good match between the candidates' skills and the clients' requirements. This involves a range of services, including talent acquisition, workforce management, and consulting to help businesses build effective teams and achieve their goals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Executive

Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Contract

Job Description
Sales Management Task:
     

            
    




	Sales Performance Oversight: Maintain up-to-date records to track and ensure targets are met by both the sales team collectively and individual vendors.


Requirements
Be a part of the TEAM across Nigeria:


	Experience: At least 6 months previous experience in sales or a related field.
	Leadership: Ability to lead a sales campaign in their respective states
	Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills.
	Strategic Thinking: Capacity to develop and implement sales strategies effectively.
	Results-Oriented: Focus on achieving and exceeding sales targets.
	Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze sales data and Market trends.
	Customer Focus: Commitment to customer satisfaction and retention.
	Organizational Skills: Managing time and prioritizing tasks efficiently.
	Adaptability: Flexibility to adjust strategies in response to market dynamics.
	Team Player: Collaborative approach to working with cross-functional teams.


Salary
N70,000 - N80,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: apexforteprofs@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Manager, Relationship & Commercial Banking Job at Stanbic IBTC Bank




        
    

        
        Stanbic IBTC Bank is a leading African banking group focused on emerging markets globally. It has been a mainstay of South Africa's financial system for 150 years, and now spans 16 countries across the African continent.

Standard Bank is a firm believer in technical innovation, to help us guarantee exceptional client service and leading edge financial solutions. Our growing global success reflects our commitment to the latest solutions, the best people, and a uniquely flexible and vibrant working culture. To help us drive our success into the future, we are looking for resourceful individuals to join our dedicated team at our offices.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Manager, Relationship & Commercial Banking

Job Ref ID: 80443887A-0001
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Job type: Full-time
Business Segment: Business & Commercial Banking

Job Description


	A Relationship Manager is accountable for a portfolio of Commercial Banking Clients.
	Commercial Banking Segment is for Companies who carry out a turnover of at least N2billion for Tier 2 and at Least N5bn Turnover annually for Tier 1.
	It is expected that the RM integrates and coordinates all Stanbic IBTC and Standard Bank Group products, services and resources in order to maximize the value of the business relationship and ensure profitability for the Bank and the Client.


Qualifications


	First degree in any field
	Minimum of Relationship management experience of at least 1-2 years in Corporate Banking
	Minimum of Relationship management experience of at least 1-2 years in Finance
	Minimum of Relationship management experience of at least 7-10 years in a commercial Bank
	Cognate experience in sales and relationship management of customers to be able to drive profitability and build relationships


Behavioural Competencies:


	Generating Ideas
	Examining Information
	Thinking Positively
	Taking Action
	Seizing Opportunities


Technical Competencies:


	Customer Understanding
	Product Knowledge
	Application and Submission Verification
	Customer Acceptance and Review
	Product Related Systems.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Receptionist",
  "description": "Urielsprout Limited - Our client is a renowned Hotel in the heart of Benin City, dedicated to delivering exceptional guest experiences through their commitment to hospitality excellence.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist

Job Location:&nbsp;Benin, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	As their trusted partner, Urielsprout is assisting in finding a professional and personable Hotel Receptionist to be the face of their establishment.
	As a Hotel Receptionist, you will be the first point of contact for guests, playing a pivotal role in ensuring their stay is memorable and seamless. This position requires a mix of customer service expertise, organizational skills, and a passion for hospitality.


Responsibilities


	Warmly welcome and assist guests during check-in and check-out processes.
	Handle reservations, cancellations, and inquiries via phone, email, and in-person interactions.
	Provide information about hotel services, amenities, and local attractions.
	Address guest concerns professionally and escalate issues when necessary.
	Process payments and maintain accurate billing records.
	Collaborate with housekeeping and other departments to meet guest needs.
	Ensure the front desk area is well-organized and presentable at all times.


Requirements


	High school diploma or equivalent (required).
	Prior experience in customer service or front desk roles (1-2 years preferred).
	A background in hospitality or tourism is advantageous.
	Availability for flexible shifts, including weekends and holidays.
	Professional grooming and appearance standards.
	A commitment to delivering outstanding guest experiences.


Qualifications:


	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency with hotel management software (e.g., Opera, Cloudbeds) and MS Office.
	Ability to multitask and stay organized in a fast-paced environment.
	A problem-solving mindset with a positive attitude.
	Fluency in [English] (additional languages are a plus).


Perks &amp; Benefits


	Salary: N70,000 - N80,000 Monthly (Competitive salary package).
	Performance-based bonuses.
	Growth opportunities in a reputable hospitality establishment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;urielsproutrecruits@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Receptionist Job at Urielsprout Limited




        
    

        
        Urielsprout Limited - Our client is a renowned Hotel in the heart of Benin City, dedicated to delivering exceptional guest experiences through their commitment to hospitality excellence.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist

Job Location: Benin, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	As their trusted partner, Urielsprout is assisting in finding a professional and personable Hotel Receptionist to be the face of their establishment.
	As a Hotel Receptionist, you will be the first point of contact for guests, playing a pivotal role in ensuring their stay is memorable and seamless. This position requires a mix of customer service expertise, organizational skills, and a passion for hospitality.


Responsibilities


	Warmly welcome and assist guests during check-in and check-out processes.
	Handle reservations, cancellations, and inquiries via phone, email, and in-person interactions.
	Provide information about hotel services, amenities, and local attractions.
	Address guest concerns professionally and escalate issues when necessary.
	Process payments and maintain accurate billing records.
	Collaborate with housekeeping and other departments to meet guest needs.
	Ensure the front desk area is well-organized and presentable at all times.


Requirements


	High school diploma or equivalent (required).
	Prior experience in customer service or front desk roles (1-2 years preferred).
	A background in hospitality or tourism is advantageous.
	Availability for flexible shifts, including weekends and holidays.
	Professional grooming and appearance standards.
	A commitment to delivering outstanding guest experiences.


Qualifications:


	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency with hotel management software (e.g., Opera, Cloudbeds) and MS Office.
	Ability to multitask and stay organized in a fast-paced environment.
	A problem-solving mindset with a positive attitude.
	Fluency in [English] (additional languages are a plus).


Perks & Benefits


	Salary: N70,000 - N80,000 Monthly (Competitive salary package).
	Performance-based bonuses.
	Growth opportunities in a reputable hospitality establishment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV and Cover Letter to: urielsproutrecruits@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Hotel Supervisor",
  "description": "Urielsprout Limited - Our client, a reputable Hotel, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Hotel Supervisor

Job Location:&nbsp;Benin, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Hotel Supervisor to join our team at our client hotel in Edo State.
	The ideal candidate must reside in Edo State and will be responsible for overseeing daily hotel operations, ensuring exceptional guest experiences, and maintaining high service standards.
	The Hotel Supervisor will play a key role in managing staff, coordinating departments, and ensuring compliance with hospitality standards and company policies.


Responsibilities
Operational Management:


	Supervise daily hotel operations, including front desk, housekeeping, and food &amp; beverage services.
	Ensure that all departments work efficiently and provide top-tier service to guests.
	Monitor and maintain hotel facilities, ensuring cleanliness, safety, and functionality.


Guest Experience &amp; Customer Service:


	Address guest concerns and complaints professionally, ensuring prompt resolution.
	Enhance guest satisfaction by ensuring smooth check-in/check-out processes and overall service quality.
	Gather and analyze guest feedback to implement improvements.


Staff Supervision &amp; Training:


	Lead, motivate, and manage hotel staff, ensuring high performance and professionalism.
	Conduct regular staff training on hospitality standards, customer service, and operational procedures.
	Schedule and assign tasks to employees while ensuring adequate staffing levels.


Financial &amp; Inventory Management:


	Assist in budgeting, financial planning, and cost control efforts.
	Monitor expenses, revenue, and profitability, ensuring financial targets are met.
	Oversee inventory management, ensuring adequate stock levels and minimizing wastage.


Compliance &amp; Safety:


	Ensure adherence to health, safety, and sanitation regulations within the hotel.
	Implement and maintain hotel policies and standard operating procedures.
	Ensure compliance with local hospitality regulations and company guidelines.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree or Diploma in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in hotel operations, preferably in a supervisory role.
	Must be a resident of Edo State.
	Strong leadership and team management skills.
	Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency in hotel management software and Microsoft Office applications.
	Ability to work flexible hours, including weekends and holidays.


Key Skills &amp; Attributes:


	Leadership: Ability to effectively manage teams and hotel operations.
	Customer Service: Strong focus on guest satisfaction and service excellence.
	Problem-Solving: Capability to handle challenges and resolve guest concerns promptly.
	Attention to Detail: Ensuring high standards in cleanliness, service, and hospitality.
	Multitasking: Ability to handle multiple responsibilities in a fast-paced environment.
	Integrity &amp; Professionalism: Commitment to ethical conduct and maintaining hotel standards.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;urielsproutrecruits@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-09-01",

Hotel Supervisor Job at Urielsprout Limited




        
    

        
        Urielsprout Limited - Our client, a reputable Hotel, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Hotel Supervisor

Job Location: Benin, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Hotel Supervisor to join our team at our client hotel in Edo State.
	The ideal candidate must reside in Edo State and will be responsible for overseeing daily hotel operations, ensuring exceptional guest experiences, and maintaining high service standards.
	The Hotel Supervisor will play a key role in managing staff, coordinating departments, and ensuring compliance with hospitality standards and company policies.


Responsibilities
Operational Management:


	Supervise daily hotel operations, including front desk, housekeeping, and food & beverage services.
	Ensure that all departments work efficiently and provide top-tier service to guests.
	Monitor and maintain hotel facilities, ensuring cleanliness, safety, and functionality.


Guest Experience & Customer Service:


	Address guest concerns and complaints professionally, ensuring prompt resolution.
	Enhance guest satisfaction by ensuring smooth check-in/check-out processes and overall service quality.
	Gather and analyze guest feedback to implement improvements.


Staff Supervision & Training:


	Lead, motivate, and manage hotel staff, ensuring high performance and professionalism.
	Conduct regular staff training on hospitality standards, customer service, and operational procedures.
	Schedule and assign tasks to employees while ensuring adequate staffing levels.


Financial & Inventory Management:


	Assist in budgeting, financial planning, and cost control efforts.
	Monitor expenses, revenue, and profitability, ensuring financial targets are met.
	Oversee inventory management, ensuring adequate stock levels and minimizing wastage.


Compliance & Safety:


	Ensure adherence to health, safety, and sanitation regulations within the hotel.
	Implement and maintain hotel policies and standard operating procedures.
	Ensure compliance with local hospitality regulations and company guidelines.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in Hospitality Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in hotel operations, preferably in a supervisory role.
	Must be a resident of Edo State.
	Strong leadership and team management skills.
	Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency in hotel management software and Microsoft Office applications.
	Ability to work flexible hours, including weekends and holidays.


Key Skills & Attributes:


	Leadership: Ability to effectively manage teams and hotel operations.
	Customer Service: Strong focus on guest satisfaction and service excellence.
	Problem-Solving: Capability to handle challenges and resolve guest concerns promptly.
	Attention to Detail: Ensuring high standards in cleanliness, service, and hospitality.
	Multitasking: Ability to handle multiple responsibilities in a fast-paced environment.
	Integrity & Professionalism: Commitment to ethical conduct and maintaining hotel standards.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV and Cover Letter to: urielsproutrecruits@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
